CatDescriptText: Mr. Adolph Benevento, college student, Bergerstown, Pa. and Mrs. Eva Jenkins, housekeeper, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 7, with question: " Do you think police could wipe out all the rackets if they launched an intense, earnest campaign against vice and crime?"  Mr. Benevento's answer reads: "I definitely think ti would be possible, if it merely were a matter of the police having the power to do so, since it is a big organization, but they wouldn't do it because the people want crime.  There wouldn't be any crime if the people didn't want it."  Mrs. Jenkins' answer reads: "If they went at it the right way, they could do it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Adolph Benevento wearing light colored t-shirt and beard; Portrait of Eva Jenkins wearing light colored dress with buttoned straps
